channel.title: Starting Off Basic
channel.description:
Ok, well, i've been scripting Scar and SRL for a while now, and its getting too easy and boring, so i want to see if i would be able to learn and script Java.
I'm starting from scratch. What would an easy, useful, basic, and fun game i would be able to make for java as a first script. Also, i've looked through video tutorials and some other websites, and they teach a lot, but never "specifically" what i seem to be looking for. So what would be a good starting script would be to make(and where can i get the java compiler thing that i code in lol). Thanks.

item.title: Starting Off Basic
item.dc:creator: @Tribal Tribal
item.description:
@Tribal wrote:

[quote=“Rune Hacker, post:12, topic:100996”][quote author=ZeroFreeze link=topic=144913.msg1394304#msg1394304 date=1180446892]
I’d suggest learning the basics of java first and working with your os’ console. Then once you’ve advanced and understood everything, to GUIs, then to applets and finally SIMPLE games.
[/quote]
Ok, im learning as I go, but i dotn see why learn stuff i will probably never need to so i learn as i use stuff. I am making an applet game, but i should learn more first. Im usign eclipse and i got everything working, but java is realyl confusing compared to SRL which im used to using lol.

btw, what do you mean “os’ console” and is a GUI, a form?[/quote]
Your operating system’s console.
And yes, GUI is a “form”

Read full topic

I’d suggest learning the basics of java first and working with your os’ console. Then once you’ve advanced and understood everything, to GUIs, then to applets and finally SIMPLE games.

Ok, im learning as I go, but i dotn see why learn stuff i will probably never need to so i learn as i use stuff. I am making an applet game, but i should learn more first. Im usign eclipse and i got everything working, but java is realyl confusing compared to SRL which im used to using lol.

btw, what do you mean “os’ console” and is a GUI, a form?

item.title: Starting Off Basic
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:8, topic:100996”][quote author=Rune Hacker link=topic=144913.msg1390903#msg1390903 date=1180393415]
I mean like pacman, tetris, pong, checkers, chess, soemthing liek that. Are those that edvanced? I think you thought i meatn an actual 3D game, i wouldnt doo that until i know a LOT.

Also, are there any places that shows to to make a basic game step by step so i can see how it is set up. Ty

EDIT: of course i would learn java before starting on one, i just want to knwo which i would learn the mots from and which would be the easiest to make.
[/quote]You’re not gonna be able to make a pong in your 1st/5th/20th day of java.[/quote]
What about on yoru 435.93rd?

Read full topic

item.title: Starting Off Basic
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

[quote=“Rune Hacker, post:5, topic:100996”]I mean like pacman, tetris, pong, checkers, chess, soemthing liek that. Are those that edvanced? I think you thought i meatn an actual 3D game, i wouldnt doo that until i know a LOT.

Also, are there any places that shows to to make a basic game step by step so i can see how it is set up. Ty

EDIT: of course i would learn java before starting on one, i just want to knwo which i would learn the mots from and which would be the easiest to make.[/quote]

Learn Java before attempting to make games. Then you gotta learn about making games with java. www.tutorialized.com

item.title: Starting Off Basic
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Don’t even think about making a game for a bit. Get yourself familiar with the very, very basics of Java, then move up slowly.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting Off Basic
item.dc:creator: @Tribal Tribal
item.description:
@Tribal wrote:

You don’t need anything else then Notepad.Just put your code in there and compile it trough command prompt.
If you want something other then Notepad then use JCreator(i use this one).

as for the tutorials i suggest you learn it here : www.sean.cruels.net/java

Read full topic

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/

Sorry, I think you need from what I read a bit of experience for a game.
